author: mani mejia
title: Voluntary.Gold: a community network
description: Worldwide cardano community lacks a decentralized platform for collaboration, leadership development, social interaction, & Incentivisation.

assessments.note: submitted multiple times and hopefully the system would throw this out in the fututure. basicaly spam. problem statement not addressed - this platform is exactly the solution to the problem

This proposal reads as a nice research paper with no real plan/strategy to go from concept to functional dApp on Cardano in the next 6 months. There are 0 benchmarks to existing community networks or metrics included in this proposal.

Nothing in the proposal leads the CA to believe this team understands the actionable steps needed to bring a dApp to life. The project plan is academic and non-actionable, the roadmap could not be more high level and its never made clear who the specific developer resources working on the Cardano smart contracts will be.

Nowhere in this proposal is it made clear how this team will transform their idea into a Plutus dApp in the next 6 months. No metrics or KPI's are included for CA's to assess and the information on the website is equally high level and lacking true technical documentation describing the protocol.
there are no metrics, no benchmarking, no Cardano Plutus developers with Haskell experience identified and the link to the website provides no additional technical documentation.

Again I return to my initial comment, this proposal is a well written research paper but fails to make the case for how it will turn into a dApp driving user demand on Cardano in the next 6 months. W/o a complete Whitepaper/technical docs, metrics or KPI's the well written aspects of this proposal become hard to weight against likelihood of successful implementation.
The proposer fails to deliver a complete dapp proposal: there is no budget breakdown, actionable project plan or technical docs describing this protocol included in the proposal or attachments.

solution: Our federated network is being built for community members to self organize, train and support each other, and be rewarded for their service
experience: Our team of 3 has 31y in web technology; 56y in volunteer mgmt; 25y in entrepreneurship; 3y in crypto; a PhD in Org Leadership; plus you too
